notes: Affirmative particle. Can be doubled ('tak, tak') for emphasis. Also used as a filler word in conversation.

sentences.sentence_en: Yes, please.
Yes, I want tea with milk.

sentences.sentence_pl: Tak naprawdę nie wiem, czy to dobry pomysł.
sentences.sentence_en: I don't really know if that's a good idea.

notes: Negation particle placed before verbs. 'Nie ma' = 'there isn't'. Double negation is standard in Polish: 'Nic nie wiem' (I don't know anything).

sentences.sentence_en: No, thank you.
I don't have time for that.

sentences.sentence_pl: Nie sądzę, żeby to było możliwe.
sentences.sentence_en: I don't think that would be possible.

notes: Personal pronoun, often omitted since verbs carry person info. Cases: mnie (gen/acc), mi/mnie (dat), mną (instr).

sentences.sentence_en: I have a cat.
I am a student from Poland.

sentences.sentence_pl: Ja bym wolał zostać w domu, gdyby padał deszcz.
sentences.sentence_en: I would prefer to stay home if it were raining.

notes: Demonstrative pronoun (neuter). 'To jest...' = 'This is...'. Also used as a conjunction meaning 'then' in conditional sentences.

sentences.sentence_en: This is a house.
This is my best friend.

sentences.sentence_pl: To, co mi powiedziałeś, zmieniło moje zdanie.
sentences.sentence_en: What you told me changed my mind.

notes: Irregular verb. Present: jestem, jesteś, jest, jesteśmy, jesteście, są. Past forms vary by gender: byłem/byłam (I was, masc/fem).

sentences.sentence_en: He is tall.
I want to be a better person.

sentences.sentence_pl: Gdybym był na twoim miejscu, nie zgodziłbym się.
sentences.sentence_en: If I were in your place, I wouldn't have agreed.

notes: Preposition governing accusative (direction) or locative (location). 'Na stole' (on the table, locative), 'na stół' (onto the table, accusative).

sentences.sentence_en: The cat is on the table.

sentences.sentence_pl: Czekam na autobus od dziesięciu minut.
sentences.sentence_en: I've been waiting for the bus for ten minutes.

sentences.sentence_pl: Na pierwszy rzut oka wydaje się, że to proste zadanie.
sentences.sentence_en: At first glance, it seems like a simple task.

notes: Reflexive pronoun, used with many verbs: uczyć się (to learn), bać się (to be afraid), cieszyć się (to be happy). Position is flexible in the sentence.

sentences.sentence_en: I am learning Polish.
I'm happy to see you.

sentences.sentence_pl: Okazało się, że nie wszystko poszło zgodnie z planem.
sentences.sentence_en: It turned out that not everything went according to plan.

notes: Interrogative pronoun. Also used as a relative pronoun: 'To, co chcę' (That which I want). Colloquially replaces 'który' (which).

sentences.sentence_en: What is this?
What are you doing on the weekend?

sentences.sentence_pl: Co by było, gdybyś mógł cofnąć czas?
sentences.sentence_en: What would it be like if you could turn back time?

notes: Demonstrative pronoun, masculine form. Feminine: ta, Neuter: to, Plural: ci (masc. personal) / te (other). Declines through all 7 cases.

sentences.sentence_en: This house is big.

sentences.sentence_pl: Ten film, który oglądaliśmy, był świetny.
sentences.sentence_en: That movie we watched was great.

sentences.sentence_pl: Ten sam problem pojawia się za każdym razem.
sentences.sentence_en: The same problem appears every time.

notes: Interrogative adverb and conjunction. 'Jak się masz?' (How are you?). Also used for comparisons: 'biały jak śnieg' (white as snow).

sentences.sentence_en: How are you?
How do I get to the train station?

sentences.sentence_pl: Jak tylko skończę pracę, zadzwonię do ciebie.
sentences.sentence_en: As soon as I finish work, I'll call you.
